Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; ENGRAVED; ENAMELLED
Name: Scaraboid
Description: Elongated, oval and rounded scaraboid with a crenellated edge (in the likeness of a cowry shell). The flat surface is inscribed with an unidentified central cartouche (probably Second Intermediate Period) flanked on either side by two facing falcons, separated by wadj signs (''green'').
